input.description: The name of the actor adapter. Default: CASDActor

This wrapper creates a new incident record in the Service Desk system.
Sample Item XML:
<items> <item> <target> <soap-url>https://172.16.1.1:8443/axis/services/USD_R11_WebService?wsdl</soap-url> <host>172.16.1.1</host> <user-name>ServiceDesk</user-name> <password>password</password> <port>8443</port> <protocol>https</protocol> <allow-unsigned-certificate>true</allow-unsigned-certificate> <install-certificate>true</install-certificate> <passphrase>changeit</passphrase> </target> <affected-end-user>System_Argis_User,,</affected-end-user> <reported-by>System_Argis_User,,</reported-by> <incident-area>Applications</incident-area> <status>Open</status> <priority>3</priority> <assignee>System_Argis_User</assignee> <group>Test Group</group> <configuration-item>Test1</configuration-item> <severity>5-All Hands Escalation</severity> <urgency>2-Soon</urgency> <impact>5-One Person</impact> <problem>47</problem> <call-back-date>11/28/2011 02:23 pm</call-back-date> <root-cause>B</root-cause> <change>219</change> <caused-by-change-order>216</caused-by-change-order> <outage-start-time>11/17/2011 02:24 pm</outage-start-time> <outage-end-time>11/18/2011 02:24 pm</outage-end-time> <summary>Test Incident</summary> <description>Test Description</description> <parent>65</parent> </item> </items>
Parameter Description:
items[Required] The parent tag that contains item details
item[Required] This tag contains the input data for individual item
target[Conditional] This tag contains the dynamic target configuration details for every item. This is required if adapter configuration is left empty.
soap-url[Optional] CA Service Desk web service SOAP url. Either "soap-url" or "host" should be specified for a valid dynamic target configuration. If both are provided "soap-url" takes precedence. Sample url format: https://<hostname>:<port>/axis/services/USD_R11_WebService?wsdl
host[Optional] Hostname or IP Address of server where CA Service Desk is installed. Either "soap-url" or "host" should be specified for a valid dynamic target configuration. If both are provided "soap-url" takes precedence.
user-name[Optional] User name required for authentication.
password[Optional] Password required for authentication.
port[Optional] Communication port for CA Service Desk application. Valid values - Any positive number greater than 0. Default value - 8080 for http, 8443 for https.
protocol[Optional] Communication protocol for CA Service Desk application. Valid values - http, https. Default value - https
install-certificate[Optional] Specifies if installation of certificates is desired. Valid values - true, false. Default value - false
allow-unsigned-certificate[Optional] Specifies if unsigned certificates need to be allowed. Valid values - true, false. Default value - false
passphrase[Optional] Password for authentication with the SSL certificate on the target server. Default value - changeit
affected-end-user[Required] Affected end user for the incident record. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
reported-by[Optional] User who requested for this incident record. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
incident-area[Optional] Incident Area for the incident record. Valid values - Valid values avaiable in the Service Desk application
status[Optional] Status of the incident record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
priority[Optional] Priority associated with the incident record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization to the default list of values is also supported.
assignee[Optional] Contact name to whom the incident is assigned. If 'group' is also specified the assignee to whom incident is assigned should be part of that group. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
group[Optional] Group to which incident record is assigned. Valid values - Valid group name
configuration-item[Optional] Configuration Item associated with the incident. Valid values - Valid confiuration items defined in the application
severity[Optional] Severity associated with the incident. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization done to the default list are also supported.
urgency[Optional] Urgency associated with the incident Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization done to the default list are also supported.
impact[Optional] Impact associated with the incident. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization done to the default list are also supported.
problem[Optional] Problem record associated with this incident. Valid values - Valid problem number
call-back-date[Optional] Call back date for this incident. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
root-cause[Optional] Root cause for this incident record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
change[Optional] Change record associated with this incident. Valid values - Valid change number
caused-by-change-order[Optional] Number of the change record which caused this incident. Valid values - Valid change number
outage-start-time[Optional] Outage start time of this incident. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
outage-end-time[Optional] Outage end time of this incident. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
summary[Optional] Summary associated with the incident record. Valid values - Any String value
description[Optional] Description associated with the incident record. Valid values - Any String value
parent[Optional] Number of the parent incident for this incident record. Valid values - Valid incident number

documentation.description: This wrapper creates a new incident record in the Service Desk system.
